Text: To all of the Utahns—and all of the athletes—competing for @TeamUSA: best of luck! There is no doubt that you all will make our great nation proud. I look forward to hearing our national anthem played many times in Beijing. We're cheering you on! https://t.co/KAD9AlWasg

Tonight, as we watch the @Olympics opening ceremonies, Salt Lake resident @BrittanyBowe will be leading @TeamUSA as a flag bearer. A Utahn has now carried the flag in back-to-back Games. I can’t wait to see our nation’s flag flying in Beijing along with our incredible Olympians! https://t.co/y2GOJ3Muan

The International Olympic Committee should never have awarded the 2022 Winter Olympic Games to Beijing. Laws enforced by the Chinese Communist Party put our athletes in unacceptable circumstances, where they must choose between personal safety or free expression. https://t.co/6NR98GRB1p

The world is different than it was in the 1960s, when the U.S. was responsible for 40% of the economy worldwide. Now it's 24%. If we want malevolent actors like China and Russia to abide by the rules of global order, we must link arms with our friends and allies around the world. https://t.co/x3TseisvRG

More important than who wins an election is that we have elections, and a democracy, in the first place. As authoritarian regimes around the world continue to gain ground, the United States cannot falter on principles of truth in our elections. https://t.co/ZoFoR4WcGq

It's unacceptable that our Olympians are in a setting where any criticism of the CCP violates Chinese law. The Olympic Games must never be awarded to authoritarian states that use the Olympics and its athletes as a platform for propaganda and jeopardize athletes' safety. https://t.co/GkEgj8xjU4

China is closely watching our response to Russia's threats in Ukraine—using it as a case study of what they could get away with in Taiwan. A strong, united effort from the U.S and our allies will send a clear warning to authoritarian governments around the world. https://t.co/M5voKttkVs

The only time Putin is lying is when his lips are moving. Anything that comes out of his mouth should be taken with a large grain of salt. In the event of a Russian invasion of Ukraine, we must be totally prepared for a unified response with our allies. https://t.co/eujSMqyPbG
Live now→ I’m joining @IgnatiusPost on @PostLive for a discussion on foreign policy, including the rising threats from Russia and China. Tune in: https://t.co/AAAPkJKplE

Looking forward to joining @IgnatiusPost soon to discuss the growing threats from Russia and China, the importance of strengthening NATO, the upcoming diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Olympics, and the rise of authoritarianism around the world. https://t.co/dR9KZZf7rv

In keeping with Utah's rich Olympic tradition, our state continues to serve as the center of winter sports in North America. Just look at the number of athletes competing this year with close Utah ties—more than a third of @TeamUSA! Looking forward to seeing Utahns on the podium. https://t.co/o5tb2aCRmX

Deficit spending at its current pace is a precursor to economic calamity—inaction on our national debt comes at a high cost to the American people. We must be able to keep up with nations like China and maintain our lead as the guide for democracy around the world. https://t.co/7tYFqD6hdJ

.@USDOT guidance prohibiting the use of bipartisan infrastructure bill funds to increase highway capacity flies in the face of the intent of our bill. Rapidly growing states like Utah are in need of expanded highways. The Administration must ensure this is implemented correctly. https://t.co/YfiVEjdBRe

The @SenateYouth Program recognizes some of the nation’s top student leaders, including Arundhati and Neve from Salt Lake City. Honored to meet with them to discuss their experience participating in the program and their goals as part of our nation's next generation of leaders. https://t.co/toYAHDlDaC

Russia and China are actively involved in upending world order, infiltrating democracies around the world and encouraging authoritarian alternatives. We must develop a strategy which supports democracy and fends off the inevitable draw of authoritarianism around the world. https://t.co/KJx5sBDtlS

Militant coups are replacing democratically-elected governments around the world, and Russia and China are actively engaged in the process—exploiting nations for their own political and economic advantages. We cannot ignore their actions to suppress global freedom and democracy. https://t.co/e1jUGITeLi

Families know that financial pressures don’t wait for a new baby to arrive. Allowing pregnant moms to claim the Child Tax Credit for their unborn children will help alleviate some of the costs through pregnancy & in the first months of their child’s life.https://t.co/PqZLqSyaE3

Proud to unveil my new and improved Senate website! https://t.co/JdLQJZ36wI has been redesigned from the ground up—making it easier for Utahns to contact my office, submit requests, and stay up to date with my efforts in Washington. Check it out ↓ https://t.co/M4ev0bSOEn

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we honor the 11 million victims—including 6 million Jews—who were senselessly murdered during the Holocaust. As #WeRemember these victims and survivors, we must reaffirm our dedication to eradicating anti-Semitism here at home and around the world.

Faith-based child welfare providers perform vital services for hundreds of thousands of foster children nationwide. The Administration’s reversal of protections for faith-based adoption & foster care agencies places ideology over the interests of children. https://t.co/ut3eL6NZtd

Parents know what is best for their kids. Proud to help introduce a resolution designating this week as National School Choice Week because every family should have the freedom to choose the model of education which best meets the needs of their children. https://t.co/zvPf4TRjq4

All human life is sacred. I stand with the women and men across the country who—in the spirit of compassion and mercy—#MarchForLife. We must serve as a voice for the voiceless, and I remain committed to protecting the innocent and defending the dignity of life. https://t.co/bJ6wjDLktG

I want an election system that allows every eligible citizen in every state in America to be able to exercise their right to vote in every single election. Democrats’ partisan election reform legislation doesn't focus on the real threats to our elections and our democracy. https://t.co/lXE8rIYw40

We should work on a bipartisan basis to tackle these issues and safeguard our elections. Democrats' legislation doesn't focus on the real threats—the corruption in counting ballots, election certification, and Congressional provisions for accepting & counting a slate of electors. https://t.co/WjIBfmU6Aq

The President and some of my Democratic colleagues have ventured from political overstatement and hyperbole to deep hysteria. Their cataclysmic predictions for failing to support their entirely partisan election reform legislation are far beyond the pale. https://t.co/c2Qblffhnn

Democrats' election reform legislation:
 
→ weakens voter ID
→ makes it easier to cheat
→ weakens voter registration safeguards
→ uses federal funding for campaigns
→ requires states to allow felons to vote
 
Let's be clear: this is a partisan takeover of our elections. https://t.co/mZF5tabDpv

Speaking of Democrats’ hyperbole & hysteria, @SenAlexPadilla & others routinely cite claims that GOP legislatures passed 34 restrictive voter access laws last year. Checking facts, I looked into the one of those 34, from Utah: it requires removal of dead people from voter rolls.

People who want voter ID are not racists.
 
People who don’t want federal funding of campaigns aren’t Bull Connor.
 
And people who insist that vote drop boxes be monitored aren’t Jefferson Davis. https://t.co/okMzaWuGqg
Live soon→ I’ll be speaking on the Senate floor about Democrats’ attempts at a partisan takeover of our federal elections. Watch here: https://t.co/mlS6RtPeXb

Today marks the beginning of the General Session for the Utah legislature, @utahhousereps and @utahsenate. Best wishes to @BradWilsonGOP, @JStuartAdams, and the entire legislative body as they work through the issues most pressing to Utahns. Thanks for your service to our state!

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. spoke: “Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.” Disparaging others will only deepen the rift that divides us. May we honor Dr. King's legacy by demonstrating respect, understanding, and grace for all of God's people. https://t.co/G0sK0MRgId

Instead of trying to unilaterally re-write the election rules in every single state, Democrats should work with Republicans on reforms to our electoral system. Democrats current efforts are nothing more than a political play to appeal to their base. https://t.co/sdvQ8urpPh

Russia is currently a gas station parading as a country—and Putin is trying to re-establish the old Soviet Union. This can’t be allowed to happen. The U.S. must work with our allies to strengthen NATO. We need a strong NATO not just for Russia, but for the emergence of China. https://t.co/8umYD9orAw

Democrats are attempting a federal takeover of our elections, which were deliberately left up to the states to keep autocracy from taking hold in America. I'm working w/ a bipartisan group of colleagues on election reforms because any change to our voting laws must be bipartisan. https://t.co/cCZGufnMHz

Senate Republicans are willing to work with the President on bipartisan solutions to the challenges facing Americans—fixing inflation, family security, health care, education, immigration. Passing the bipartisan infrastructure bill proved that there are things we can do together. https://t.co/vbr3MRZaoT

The 1st year of the Biden Administration has been 52 bad weeks:

-7% inflation
-botched Afghanistan withdrawal
-COVID resurgence & testing shortage
-disaster at our southern border
 
POTUS needs to stop trying to transform America and work to unify the country, like he promised. https://t.co/xhrhASZC6c

It must be made very clear to Putin: There will be extraordinary consequences should any action be taken to invade Ukraine or overthrow its government. And these consequences must be in coordination with our allies. Shutting down Nord Stream 2 would be a good place to start. https://t.co/9782qrLYin

Russia is trying to blackmail Europe while playing a victim. Nord Stream 2 gives Putin more leverage over Ukraine and makes Western Europe more dependent on Russia. I'll continue to work with my colleagues on ways to push back against Russian aggression. https://t.co/WmzhwuBHYK

It’s absurd to claim that to 'save a democracy,' a party that represents barely half the country is entitled, entirely by itself, to trample the rules of its senior democratic institution. Legislation of consequence must be a product of bipartisan compromise to be effective. https://t.co/NVyENHdNgx

Our country is sharply divided—and there are still those who believe the lie that the 2020 election was stolen by Democrats. Now imagine the anger and division that would be ignited if Democrats re-write, with no Republican involvement whatsoever, the voting laws in this country. https://t.co/QEMxNhDf8g

Best of luck to our freestyle skiers competing this week at the Intermountain Healthcare Freestyle International in Park City. We’re cheering you on and hope you enjoy the ‘greatest snow on earth!’ https://t.co/Fz3ed9p9QX

Eliminating the filibuster—the 60-vote threshold—makes little sense when Democrats' legislative priorities can't even get 50 votes. Efforts to abolish the filibuster seem like a solution in search of a problem—and one Democrats may soon regret very much. https://t.co/6OzyQamj6u

Many claim the filibuster is racist, yet I don't recall a single claim from Democrats that employing the filibuster was racist when they were in the minority. Now, with the barest of majorities, they are conveniently ignoring their own impassioned defense of the filibuster. https://t.co/hNSx99oICy

The Senate is one of our vital democratic institutions, and the power given to the minority is one of its defining features. Eliminating the filibuster would give way to extremism by removing the requirement for political consensus, which is in Americans’ best interests. https://t.co/7Af2SFRXs5
I’ll be speaking on the Senate floor about Democrats’ radical attempts to remake our governmental institutions by eliminating the Senate filibuster. Watch live: https://t.co/YUtlCf5Kwk

Successful businesses rely on daily information to make sound decisions—the government should follow suit for tracking COVID-19. We must find a better solution to collect and synthesize pandemic data on a daily basis so our federal agencies can operate more effectively. https://t.co/tOYWv37HJB

The lack of COVID tests available amid the Omicron surge is a result of the Administration's failure to build up testing capacity while infections were relatively low. Given the uncertainty of this virus, we must ensure that we're prepared for the new variants and future surges. https://t.co/ZN9Uk8gkK2
After 126 years of statehood, Utah shines brighter than ever. Grateful to call our beautiful state home. Happy birthday, Utah! https://t.co/IqjPbxQAO8

In stark contrast to Democrats' social spending bill, our bipartisan infrastructure bill invests in our physical infrastructure without raising taxes or adding trillions to our debt. Proud to have worked with a bipartisan group of senators to negotiate and pass our bill in 2021. https://t.co/zkjTYV8YgN

As we plan for the year ahead, I remain committed to addressing our rising national debt, the threat China poses to the global order, our changing climate, and fighting for Utah priorities in Washington. It is an honor to serve Utahns in the U.S. Senate. https://t.co/iUFVaW3gkn

Despite a somewhat somber year with unpredictable challenges, I was honored to serve the people of Utah by introducing and passing several bills in 2021 that will make a positive difference in the lives of Utahns and all Americans. My reflection on 2021→ https://t.co/iUFVaW3gkn

I will continue to fight for Utah values and priorities in the new year and oppose bad policies that would result in higher taxes, more spending and debt, and the federal takeover of some of our core institutions. Read my 2021 Year in Review report here: https://t.co/PnSbvzz8dB https://t.co/Sy4EODuJtV

This year, my efforts focused on addressing long-term infrastructure needs, the increasing China threat, and helping Utah tackle climate issues. My team and I also assisted with 1,800 casework claims, responded to 720,000 pieces of mail & met with hundreds of constituent groups.

Congratulations to Sgt. Breanna J. Jessop from Myton, Utah, for being named @the_USO Soldier of the Year! Sgt. Jessop—we’re proud of your valiant efforts to help Afghan children at a time when they were most vulnerable. I encourage all to read her inspiring and heroic story. https://t.co/svZYvewN2d

The United States will not standby as the Chinese Communist Party commits genocide against the Uyghurs. Our bipartisan Uyghur Forced Labor Prevention Act, now law, will help keep China accountable by ensuring no goods made with Uyghur slave labor are sold in American markets. https://t.co/YL0ZweXVLd

This year, we’ve seen tragedies around the world and faced difficulties here at home. Despite it all, many have stepped up to ensure the well-being of others. It’s my hope that we find peace and comfort in those who make the world a better place. Merry Christmas, Happy Holidays!

Now that it’s clear “Build Back Better” isn’t moving forward & with bipartisan opposition to extending the President’s ill-crafted Child Tax Credit, the Administration has an opportunity to actually work with Republicans & Democrats on lasting, fiscally-responsible family policy. https://t.co/6ePaFrYciA

Thanks to our bipartisan infrastructure bill, long-needed resources will be delivered to Utah communities like Stockton, which has awaited funding to address critical cleanup of contaminated soils. Proud to have helped negotiate this legislation. https://t.co/1CAII2PhBd

Utahns understand the need for better solutions to curb wildfires. Thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure bill, a commission aimed at improving strategies to prevent, mitigate and respond to wildfires—which I proposed with @SenMarkKelly—is now a reality. https://t.co/47QxNtyxf5

With record unemployment numbers well below the national average, Utah continues to lead the nation in economic vitality and job security. Kudos to the hardworking Utahns and employers in our state for their commitment to job creation and growth. https://t.co/D4wDK4XOgk

Great to see @TeamUSA back in the historic @UtahOlympicOval—the best venue for speed skating. Best of luck to the athletes competing in the trials this weekend—we’re cheering you on! https://t.co/aJmYB9pLXu

Proud that this bill has become law. The Congressional Gold Medal is the highest honor Congress can bestow, and we remain forever indebted to the 13 heroes we lost during the terrorist attacks outside the Kabul airport this summer, including Utah’s own Staff Sgt. Taylor Hoover. https://t.co/A50edD3hGN

The Chinese Communist Party's genocide of the Uyghur people is one of the greatest human rights atrocities of our generation. Proud that our Uyghur Forced Labor Prevention Act is finally set to become law! Goods made with Uyghur slave labor have no place being sold in America. https://t.co/aDb7zvw9ml

Utah's continued growth requires key investments in innovative infrastructure. The construction of a new rail line—connecting various industries in the Uinta Basin—will further boost economic growth. Proud to have joined the Utah delegation in supporting this project. https://t.co/s6rPK6iKhY

Democrats' "Build Back Better Plan" is greatly flawed—it's bad policy and the process of crafting the bill has been equally terrible. Legislation that affects something as important as our children, and how we raise our children, must be bipartisan. https://t.co/w7s3xTAwOx

This summer we lost 13 incredibly brave U.S. servicemembers—including Staff Sgt. Taylor Hoover, of Sandy, UT—during the terrorist attacks outside the Kabul airport in Afghanistan. Our defense bill authorizes a memorial to honor these American heroes. https://t.co/RKEnki70UA

This year's NDAA, which passed the Senate today, boosts Utah's ability to help strengthen our national security. It supports @HAFB's role in bolstering the U.S. nuclear deterrent and helps Utah's bases and installations hire talented military retirees. https://t.co/RKEnki70UA

Child care proposals included in the Democrats' partisan spending bill would diminish parents' choices on how their children are raised, while my plan would empower parents. I encourage my Democrat colleagues to work with us on a bipartisan solution to care for our kids. https://t.co/afhbHBajqe

Democrats have chosen to go it alone on child care, which is just one reason why their "Build Back Better" plan is so flawed. There is a significant opportunity to create legislation that actually works for hardworking families—but if only Democrats would reach across the aisle. https://t.co/k4vL9HfHYd

Decisive action is needed to confront China’s growing aggression & dissuade them from pursuing a predatory path around the world. Proud that this year’s defense bill includes my measure to require the U.S. to develop a unified, strategic approach to China. https://t.co/RKEnki70UA

Families, localities, and churches—not the federal government—should be in charge of what’s being taught and instilled in our young children. I'm joining my colleagues to discuss why the Democrats' "Build Back Better" child care proposals should give everyone serious pause. https://t.co/dUGtGaroMf

.@UUtah’s Research Park plays a pivotal role in supporting Utah’s strong economy. Our bill will ensure that Research Park continues to provide opportunities for Utahns, advance research and development, and foster innovation for years to come. https://t.co/ixS5YGlfr5

Met with Angelina Jolie to discuss ways in which we can support children and families at home and abroad. I’m grateful for her work as a Goodwill Ambassador and for her continued advocacy for the vulnerable. https://t.co/wccmXNzhHo

Medicaid programs are best managed by the states. Our legislation would give states like Utah more freedom and flexibility to manage their Medicaid program, and continue to provide health coverage to those who depend on it. https://t.co/jcmHw3iOVf

Industries like diesel and transportation are experiencing major shortages in drivers and technicians. It’s critical that we support and bolster training programs for young people–opening doors to stable, high-paying trade careers like those provided at Utah's @KenworthSalesCo. https://t.co/O2QnFHcuPr

Ann and I mourn the lives lost and communities devastated by tornadoes this past weekend. Our prayers go out to all those suffering through this unthinkable tragedy. 
 
I join @LeaderMcConnell in thanking the first responders working tirelessly to save lives and reduce suffering. https://t.co/YRjooQg6As

The CCP is tightening its grip on the people of Hong Kong—continuing its quest to roll back precious civil liberties. The court’s decision to imprison pro-democracy leaders, like Jimmy Lai, further enables the CCP and its cronies in Hong Kong to crush political dissent. https://t.co/N4ezo4tbZG

Happy birthday to the @USNationalGuard! Throughout this difficult year, members of our own @UTNationalGuard have consistently answered the call to protect Americans in time of emergency and respond to threats around the world. Thank you for your service to our country. https://t.co/4eLqJQGAwc
Rest in peace to the man from Russell, Kansas, who forever remains a shining symbol of the Greatest Generation. https://t.co/Tf1t9vq7fc

Applaud PM Trudeau’s decision that Canada would join a diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Games. The CCP’s genocide of the Uyghurs is reprehensible & never again should a nation which so blatantly violates the human rights of its own citizens get the honor of hosting the Olympics. https://t.co/f8tcZ3qVSk

China's military threats toward Taiwan’s sovereignty should alarm free nations around the world. An invasion of Taiwan must have severe costs. It's imperative that we partner with our allies to counter China’s aggression and strengthen policies that support Taiwan’s freedom. https://t.co/hoDHO2VH5j

Withholding diplomats from the Beijing Olympics will bring attention to the Chinese Communist Party’s graves human rights abuses, genocide of the Uyghurs, and threat China poses to the global order. It's incumbent upon the media to accurately report on what's happening in China. https://t.co/ipUFtlU0nI

We must link arms with our allies to try to divert the CCP from its current course. Australia, New Zealand, Lithuania, and now our greatest friend—the United Kingdom—have announced a diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Olympics. I hope other free nations join us in this effort. https://t.co/GN0uWKqsez
Proud to see our friend Australia announce a diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Olympic Games. The world must be made aware of the CCP’s genocide of the Uyghur people. https://t.co/49LUb4XIAn

Where there's courage, there is often pain. While there may be ramifications of our diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Olympics, our government will make it very clear that we do not stand for the egregious human rights violations we are seeing executed by the CCP. https://t.co/xgErQ2iCWJ

Our Olympians have trained their entire lives to compete and the burden of our foreign policies shouldn’t rest on their shoulders. A full U.S. boycott of the Moscow Games in 1980 not only took away the dreams of American athletes, but allowed the USSR to win the most medals. https://t.co/dAgp9haN1a

China is trying to mollify the global community—tricking nations to think that they play by the rules. A diplomatic boycott of the Beijing @Olympics by the U.S. must spark a global discussion on the Chinese Communist Party's repressive regime & shed light on the Uyghur genocide. https://t.co/aa65nUKnwp

The world needs to understand what’s happening in China. Coverage by the free media of the Beijing @Olympics should broadcast not only the great accomplishments of our athletes, but the grave human rights atrocities being carried out by the CCP, including the Uyghur genocide. https://t.co/ugPrtOh623

Today, 80 years since the "date which will live in infamy," we pause to honor the heroic Americans who lost their lives during the sudden attacks at Pearl Harbor. May we never forget their unfettered determination to protecting the freedoms and values we hold dear. https://t.co/DKepImwEem

A diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Olympics will shine a light on the CCP’s grave human rights abuses and genocide of Uyghurs without penalizing American athletes. I can’t wait for our National Anthem to be played in China loud and clear for the Chinese Communist Party to hear. https://t.co/8kX4POQxrW
Wishing this incredible team all the best tonight. Let’s bring it home, @byusoccer_w! #GoCougs https://t.co/DViCOnNqwW

A diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Games sends the right message to the CCP without punishing U.S. athletes. Never again must the @Olympics be awarded to a nation which commits genocide and so blatantly violates the human rights of its own citizens.https://t.co/khazeG5QmX

America must not lend its credibility to the Chinese Communist Party, which represses ethnic & religious minorities—committing genocide against its Uyghur citizens. @TimKaine and I applaud the President’s decision to withhold a diplomatic presence from the Beijing Olympic games. https://t.co/VapgY2MLgp

When companies and politicians avert their eyes from China’s predations and slavery, they are effectively paying the cannibals to eat them last. It is in our best interest to shift our efforts abroad to investments and relationships that won't leave us beholden to the CCP. https://t.co/t25YYJhw1x

Labor shortages are driving up costs on meat and produce. I frequently hear from Utah’s agriculture producers that they simply don’t have enough workers. We must find a solution that expands H-2A visas to ease burdens placed on our producers and drive down costs for families.
It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas for Team Romney🎄 https://t.co/WkdeRa2BbZ

Our Christmas tree—over 12 feet tall—made its way through the halls of the Senate to our office in Washington this week. Glad my staff saved me the best ornaments of them all–a hot dog and a twinkie! https://t.co/mFxJ0JTFBg
My statement on tonight’s short-term spending bill: https://t.co/AIls6LcKkh

Good news→ over $63M in funding for water infrastructure is heading to Utah in 2022! These funds—authorized in our bipartisan infrastructure bill—will help improve our state’s water treatment and management facilities, bringing cleaner and more accessible water to Utahns.

Democratic leadership is blocking a bill that would prevent goods made with Uyghur slave labor in China from being sold in the U.S. Let's be clear: they need cheap batteries for their "Build Back Better" agenda. Most of the materials used to make those batteries come from China. https://t.co/mAVprRHafT
